decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost Human creatures and utilizing disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage slow down the opponent's strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures like Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider, supported by anthem effects like Thalia's Lieutenant. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support the Human tribal theme.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive spirit creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage. The combination of Aether Vial and Collected Company allows for efficient creature deployment, while Noble Hierarch and Supreme Phantom boost the team's power. Selfless Spirit protects the team from board wipes, while Drogskol Captain provides additional buffs. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of speed, disruption, and synergy among the spirit creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful creature with hexproof using auras to make it unstoppable. By protecting the creature and enhancing its power with auras like Ethereal Armor and Rancor, combined with cards like Daybreak Coronet and Spirit Mantle, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient threat. Path to Exile provides removal options while cards like Kor Spiritdancer allow for card draw to keep the momentum going. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with a mix of white and green sources.

The main concept of this Aggro Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards using efficient cantrips and spells, then utilize the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield by casting three or more instants or sorceries in a single turn. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and recurring threats like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The deck's focus is on tempo and applying pressure early in the game to secure a win.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam to trigger powerful graveyard-based effects such as bringing back creatures like Narcomoeba and Bloodghast. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the deck can dig deeper into its library and set up explosive combo plays with Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of creatures and burn spells, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to fuel a fast and lethal game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also has the ability to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in using instants and sorceries from the graveyard, while cards like Mishra's Bauble help to enable the Death's Shadow strategy. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent by using low cost, efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage directly to the opponent. The goal is to maintain pressure and end the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The deck relies on a combination of creature aggression and direct damage spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. By efficiently utilizing its resources, this deck aims to win the game in the early turns through aggressive and relentless attacks.

This deck focuses on playing a fast and aggressive game with Spirit creatures, utilizing their abilities to disrupt opponents and protect your own creatures. The key strategy is to quickly build a board presence with creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Spell Queller, while also benefiting from tribal synergies with cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt opponents' plans, while cards like Deputy of Detention and Path to Exile provide removal options. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, giving you a competitive edge in the early game.

The deck focuses on combining artifact creatures with powerful equipment like Cranial Plating to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggression. Using mana acceleration from Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Signal Pest and Vault Skirge while protecting them with counterspells like Metallic Rebuke. With various ways to pump up creatures and evasion from cards like Inkmoth Nexus, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they can stabilize. The synergy between artifacts and creatures is the key to success in this aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a powerful, hexproof creature by enchanting it with auras that boost its abilities and protect it from removal spells. By creating a creature that is difficult to target or block, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with damage while keeping their own life total safe through cards like Leyline of Sanctity. The deck focuses on aggression and resilience, using cards like Daybreak Coronet and Ethereal Armor to create an unstoppable threat on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with low-cost, high-damage creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal as much damage as possible in the early turns to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The deck includes efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with a variety of burn spells to finish off the opponent. It aims to win the game through fast and aggressive plays, overwhelming the opponent with a relentless onslaught of damage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures such as Griselbrand, Worldspine Wurm, and Borborygmos Enraged using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. The deck also utilizes cards like Nourishing Shoal and Simian Spirit Guide to provide mana acceleration and card draw. The strategy is to combo off and win the game in a single explosive turn by cheating out big threats early in the game. The deck focuses on instant reanimation and combo plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck aims to aggressively fill the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith and Faithless Looting to cheat out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Bloodghast. Utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to dig through the deck quickly, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and burn spells like Lightning Bolt. Gurmag Angler and Flamewake Phoenix provide additional threats to close out the game quickly, making it difficult for the opponent to recover. The deck's mana base supports its aggressive playstyle by providing consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on aggressively utilizing the Death's Shadow card to quickly lower its own life total and pump up the power of Death's Shadow. The deck includes cards that can help lower life total, such as Street Wraith and Thoughtseize, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the opponent's creatures. Snapcaster Mage and Stubborn Denial provide additional versatility and protection. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a massive Death's Shadow while maintaining control over the board.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap burn spells and creatures with prowess abilities. By efficiently casting spells and utilizing the graveyard to bring back Arclight Phoenix, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage helps to maintain card advantage and keep the aggression going.

The main idea of this Modern deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells and efficiently cast Arclight Phoenix to bring it back from the graveyard. By combining aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they can stabilize. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting and Bedlam Reveler provide card advantage and help maintain the deck's momentum.
